title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 648.4 - Natural resource management
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 648.4 - Natural resource management

State Regulations
(a) It
is unlawful for any person to: (1)
knowingly
introduce, collect, deface, remove, destroy or otherwise injure in any manner
whatsoever any plant, animal or other living or non-living feature except as
otherwise herein authorized by the commission or department; (2)
feed wildlife; (3)
kindle, build, maintain or use a
fire; (4)
excavate or remove sand
or other soils; or
(5)
apply any
pesticide or herbicide to any plant, animal, or other living or nonliving
feature. (b) Proposals
for research projects by a person or group must be submitted in writing and be
approved by the commission in writing before the project may be
undertaken. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
648.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
